page.title: 17BOYLESTONE
page.content: BOYLESTONE IS QUITE A SMALL VILLAGE OFF THE MAIN ROAD(A 515 ASHBOURNE TO SUDBURY)BUT IT IS WITHIN EASY TRAVELLING DISTANCE OF DERBY, ASHBOURNE,BURTON AND UTTOXETER. THE BUILDINGS IN BOYLESTONE ARE MAINLY OLD,BUILT BEFORE 1900,AND THERE ARE VERY FEW BUILDINGS THAT ARE NEW. THE BUILDINGS THAT ARE NEW WERE BUILT SINCE 1950,AND INCLUDE 3 HOUSES, 3 BUNGALOWS,1 HOUSE UNDER CONSTRUCTION AND 1 BARN BEING CONVERTED. BOYLESTONE HAS QUITE A FEW AMENITIES, INCLUDING A POST OFFICE/SHOP,A PUBLIC HOUSE,A PUBLIC TELEPHONE,A CHURCH,A CHAPEL,AND A VILLAGE HALL.THE LATTER WAS USED AS A SCHOOL UNTIL 1950. BOYLESTONE USED TO BE A FARMING VILLAGE,AND THERE ARE STILL 12 FARMS, BUT IT IS NOW BECOMING A COMMUTER VILLAGE WITH PEOPLE LIVING IN THERE BUT WORKING IN NEARBY TOWNS.
